results.name: default/mysql-7d7949bff4-zg2vq
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is unable to pull the Docker image "mysql:5.7" from the registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull mysql:5.7`.

results.name: default/wordpress-7d79df6474-q54vq
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-7d7949bff4-zg2vq], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is not ready because the expected pod is not available or not running.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. If not running, inspect with `kubectl describe pod mysql-7d7949bff4-zg2vq`.
3. Review logs using `kubectl logs mysql-7d7949bff4-zg2vq`.
4. Resolve any issues found.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-7d79df6474-q54vq], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the expected pod is not ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod wordpress-7d79df6474-q54vq`. 3. Look for issues in events/logs. 4. Resolve any errors found, such as image pull errors or failed readiness probes.
